Comments/ Action Taken: A total of 168 cases reported from urban area of Guntur in 9th week (11 March 2018). In the following a total of 1819 cases were reported from several areas of Guntur Municipal corporation. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Pipeline leakage were observed in the Out of 39 stool samples, 23 rectal swab, were collected and sent to Guntur Medical College and Regional lab; 30 samples were positive for E.coli, 21 were positive for Klebsiella oxytoca, 2 were positive and Candida spp., 1 was positive for Klebsiella oxytoca and Pseudomonas spp., 1 positive for Proteus to Guntur Medical lab; 24 water samples had high MPN of Coliform bacteria count, 21 were positive for Klebsiella spp. and 4 water provided. All cases treated

Current Status: Cases of vomiting with loose stools reported from Village, Marchoi (Middle Marchoi) Block Satgawan. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Outbreak was possibly due to consumption of contaminated food in a communal feast. 03 stool samples sent for culture to NICED Kolkata. Food samples (mustard oil, refine, and sweets) collected for analysis; result awaited. Health camp organized in school and all cases treated symptomatically. Relevant health education given.

Cases reported from Village CHC Azhikode, PHC Valapattanam, FWC Manna, National Highway side. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Presence of larval breeding of Aedes mosquito at construction sites was observed. 03 samples tested for Dengue IgM & NS1 at RPH Lab Kannur and all were positive. 04 cases were NS1 Antigen positive. Fever clinics and symptomatic treatment given in the affected area. Vector surveillance, intensified source reduction activities, anti-larval sprays, guppy fish release done.

A total of 397 cases of loose stools and vomiting reported from Villages Ramnagar, Shyamnagar, Gammru, SC Dharmkot, Chola Tau, PHC Meclodganj in 19th week (week ending 13th May 2018). Further a cumulative of 498 cases were reported from 3rd May to 27th may 2018. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search of cases done. Heavy rains reported in the affected areas. The energized hand pumps were contaminated during the rains and the community consumed contaminated water. Water samples from water storage tanks (wst) from the affected villages were collected; WST Dholadhpur was not fit for consumption. Chlorine tablets, ORS packets and Zinc tablets were distributed in the community. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

A total of 9 cases and 7 deaths were reported in 20th week (week ending 20th may 2018). Further a cumulative of 17 cases and 14 deaths were reported from 3rd May to 27th may 2018. Isolation wards identified and infection control protocol strengthened. Adequate PPE and other logistics ensured in the district. Burial protocol issued. Medical camps conducted in the area for disease awareness and reducing panic. NCDC team was supporting the State in outbreak containment.

A total of 02 more cases and 03 more deaths reported in the current week from 17 cases and 14 deaths reported in week 21. Nipah cell of the state established for contact tracing and ensuring home quarantine. Core committee daily review meeting held under the chairmanship of District Collector. State had enlisted a total of 2084 contacts of 19 cases from the village panchayats and following up on daily basis.

Cases reported from Village Mani Majra (Indra Colony). District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 01 stool culture for Cholera, Vibrio Cholerae (OGAWA) positive at DPHL Manimajra. 05 Water samples (H2S method) were collected from affected area- Fit. 140 houses were surveyed in affected area, 01 Diarrhea case in the area. IEC activities carried out. Chlorine tablet distributed in the affected area. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Outbreak is under surveillance from week 23. Cases of loose stools reported from Village Nangal, SC- Nangal, Block- Ratia. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 15 water samples collected for Orthotoluidine test; 05 samples were chlorinated. 03 samples were sent to CH Lab Fatehabad for Bacteriological testing; result awaited. 25 new cases and one death reported. A temporary dispensary established for providing symptomatic treatment. Moderate to severe patients are admitted in Civil Hospital, Ratia. Pipes have been repaired and drinking water has been hyper- chlorinated. Halogen tablets and ORS distributed in the community.

This is a follow-up outbreak reported in 19th week. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Water samples for coliform sent to MC Tanda Sample found >1800 coliform per 100ml. Water Storage Tank of Dholadhar Public school Shamnagar found 14 coliform per 100 ml of Water (UNFIT) Sample Collected On 11-05-2018 Water Sample collected from WSS Ramnagar ,Inflitration Gallery no. 1(Near Naresh Master House)<1 MPN/100 ml of Water/ Excellent Quality of water Fit for drinking. Water Sample from WSS Ramnagar, Shamnagar Infiltration gallery no.1 (Near Shiv Vihar Temple) < MPN/100 ml of Water excellent quality of water Fit for Drinking. Fever cases reported from North Goa district since 23rd week. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 09 serum samples tested at North Goa DPL were positive for IgM Dengue. 17 samples were positive for NS1Ag at MCVR, Manipal University Karnataka. Mosquito breeding identified in abandoned arecanuts leaves due to water logging from sprinklers and rain water. IEC activities done. All cases treated symptomatically. Anti-larval and source reduction measures undertaken.

West Bengal (Follow up of 34th week outbreak 1079)
Current Status: Under Surveillance
Comments/ Action Taken: Cases reported from Village Kashthakhali, SC Barsundra, GP Baruttarhingly, Block Haldia. District RRT investigated the outbreak. A clustering of cases was observed. No history of migration noted among cases. A total of 139 samples for Dengue NS1 and 22 for Dengue MAC ELISA was collected and 25 were positive for NS1 and 4 MAC ELISA IgM. All cases were treated symptomatically. Fever camp conducted in the affected area. Entomological survey done and revealed HI 11.9%, BI 33.33%, CI 10%, PI 4 at Kastakhali on 20.08.19 and HI 9.8%, BI 17.64%, CI 6.52% at Kastakhali on 26.08.19. Potential breeding sites identified. Source reduction activities undertaken. Health education given.

Date of Start of Outbreak: Cases of fever with arthralgia reported from Village-SC Mylapur, PHC Thrikkovilvattom, Block Palathara, District Kollam. Medical team investigated the outbreak. Active search for fever cases done. Cases treated at local health centre. Out of 14 serum samples collected, 5 samples were positive for Dengue (IgM ELISA). Fogging done in the affected area. IEC done.

Date of Reporting: Outbreak of fever with joint pain reported from Village Musiri, SC Pulivalam, PHC Chinnakodunthurai, Block Veeramanipatti, District Tiruchirapalli. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search for fever cases done. Cases treated at local health centre. All 22 blood smears examined tested negative for malaria. Out of 4 serum samples collected 1 sample was positive for Chikungunya (IgM ELISA). Anti-larval activities and fogging done. IEC done.

Outbreak of fever with rash reported from Villages Mishargangti (34 cases) & Bihari (39 cases), SC Budhwachawk, PHC Meherma, Block Thakurgangti, District Godda. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Most of the cases were below 15 years. All cases treated. Health education given regarding isolation of cases

Outbreak of loose motion reported from Village Mahultanr, SC Chatuhansa, Block Arsha, District Purulia. District RRT investigated the outbreak. People consumed water from stream and well. People practice open defecation. Cases treated at temporary health camp organized in the community. 1 death occurred in a patient aged 22 years. Out of 5 stool samples collected and sent to BMCH Bankura, 3 samples were positive for V. cholerae (O1 ogawa). Disinfection of surrounding done. Chlorination of water sources done. IEC done regarding safe drinking water.

Cases of loose motion and vomiting reported from Village-SC Champabati, PHC-Block Sidli, District Chirang. Medical team investigated the outbreak. Cases consumed food in community function. Cases treated at Civil Hospital. Health education given.

Outbreak of loose motions, vomiting, abdominal pain reported from Village Sawarajpur (Chota & Boro), PHC Dhatrigram, Block Kalna-I, District Burdwan. District RRT investigated the outbreak. People consumed food (wheat flour, milk, banana) in Sani Puja. Temporary medical camp was organized in the locality. Symptomatic treatment given to cases. Cases were treated at SDH Kalna. All cases recovered. 1 food sample & 1 rectal swab sample collected & sent to BMCH; result awaited. IEC done.

Outbreak of loose motion reported from Village Pursuuttampur, SC Nasibpur, District Hoogly. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All cases treated locally. 2 rectal swabs collected; result awaited. ORS and chlorine tablets distributed in the community. IEC regarding hygiene and sanitation done.

Cases of loose motion reported from Village Basantpur, (Mahadalit tola), SC Karvandia, Block Sasaram, District Madhubani. Block health team investigated the outbreak. Cases consumed food in marriage ceremony of Gond Mahadalit community. Medicine and ORS packets given to cases. 8 cases treated at Sadar Hospital. Health education given.

Cases of loose motion and vomiting reported from Village Raherdaga, SC Shyampaur, Block Joypur, District Purulia. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search of cases done. People consumed tube well water in the affected area. 1 stool sample collected was positive for cholera culture. All cases treated symptomatically. Disinfection of the surroundings done. ORS packets distributed in the community. Health talks organized in the community. IEC leaflets regarding hygiene and sanitation distributed in the community.

Cases of diarrhoea reported from Village Ketya, SC Rampur, Block Kashipur, Block Kotshila, District Purulia. Block medical team investigated the outbreak. Active search for cases done. People consumed water from tube well. Open defecation is rampant. 1 stool sample collected ; result awaited. Disinfection of the surrounding done. ORS packets distributed. IEC done through leaflets regarding personal hygien and safe drinking water.

Date of Start of Outbreak: Cases reported from Village Bhendianavagaon, Block-District Balod. District RRT and block health team investigated the outbreak. Temporary medical camp organized. All cases treated.

IEC done regarding personal protective measures and environmental sanitation.

Current Status: Outbreak reported from Girigondanahalli village, Dodderi PHC, Madhugiri Taluka, due to consumption of contaminated food at a function. District RRT visited the affected area. Date of Start of Outbreak: Outbreak reported from Hemavathi Reservoir Project Colony, Gorur block, due to consumption of supply water contaminated by leakage of pipeline- District RRT investigated, Patients referred to General Hospital, Arakalagud for treatment- 3 out of 5 water samples found contaminated on lab test- Stool samples sent to PHI, Bangalore, result inconclusive and negative for cholera- Chlorination of water sources done- IEC undertaken on use of boiled water and sanitation-

Current Status: Outbreak reported from Village Farsho, BPHC Gairsam. District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. Cases examined and treated cases. There is no history of food poisoning and source of drinking water is local spring water. Water samples sent for lab testing; result awaited. Sanitation and hygiene being maintained and intake of boiled water advised.

Date of Reporting: Outbreak reported from Village Rainda, Block Nabagram, GP Shivpuri due to consumption of contaminated food (Prasad) at a function- Block medical team visited the affected area- Medical camp organized in the village- Food sample (Prasad) and stool samples collected and sent to Dist PH lab for investigation- Culture of food samples was positive for Staphylococci- IEC activities undertaken regarding safe drinking water, safe food and hygienic practices- Active surveillance going on-

Current Status: Outbreak reported from village Thenmathur Kamaraj Nagar Colony, PHC Pavithram, Block Thiruvannamalai. District RRT investigated the outbreak. IEC activities undertaken regarding safe drinking water, hygienic practices and sanitation measures.

Date of Start of Outbreak: A total of 17 cases and 4 deaths were reported from several districts Dantewada (6 cases and 3 deaths), Bijapur (4 cases), Bastar (4 cases), Sukma (2 cases), Dhamtari (1 case and 1 death) since January - 14 December 2017. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All 17 cases were positive for JE (IgM ELISA). 3 deaths occurred in less than 5yrs and 1 death occurred in 13yr old male. All the cases were less than 13yrs of age. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Current Status: Outbreak reported from Villages Kakod, Mewadi, Gaza, Chilwal, and Block Okhalkanda. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Affected children are in age group 1- 14 years. Symptomatic treatment & Vitamin A supplementation given to all cases. Health education given regarding isolation and early treatment of cases.

Date of Reporting: Cases reported from Village Udagatti, PHC Kaladagi, Taluka Bagalkot. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 2 food samples and 1 water sample sent to PHI (Public Health Institute), Benagluru. Lab result is awaited. Health education regarding food hygiene given.

Current Status: Cases reported from Anjangaon Surji urban area, Block Anjangaon Surji due to consumption of contaminated water. District RRT investigated the outbreak. All cases treated symptomatically.10 serum samples collected and sent to NIV, Pune out of which 3 samples tested positive for Hepatitis E by IgM Elisa. Chlorination of water sources done. Health education given regarding safe drinking water given.

Date of Start of Outbreak: Cases reported from Village Paswantola, HSC Belmohan, PHC Ghoghardiha, Block Ghoghardiha, District Madhubani. District RRT investigated the outbreak. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given regarding isolation of cases.

Current Status: Outbreak reported from Taluka Hadgaon, PHC Aashti, SC Hadgaon possibly due to contamination of drinking water. Case distributed in all wards. 14 samples collected and sent to NIV, Pune. 2 samples tested positive for Viral Hepatitis – A. Samples tested non-reactive for Hepatitis – E and Hepatitis – B. Water leakages closed. Health education given. Treatment given to the cases.

It was mentioned in the previous week (week ending 25th March 2012) that 42 cases and 3 deaths occurred in Andhra Pradesh due to Influenza A H1N1. From 26th March 2012 to 1st April 2012, further 19 cases and 1 death occurred in the state. These new cases are mostly reported from Hyderabad and Ranga Reddy districts.

It was mentioned in the previous week (week ending 1st April 2012) that 61 cases and 4 deaths occurred in Andhra Pradesh due to Influenza A H1N1. From 2nd April to 8th April 2012, further 15 cases and 2 death occurred in the state. These new cases are mostly reported from Hyderabad and Ranga Reddy districts

Cases of abdominal pain and vomitting reported from Village Anji, PHC Anji, Block Wardha, District Wardha, due to consumption of contaminated food. (religious festival). District RRT investigated the outbreak. 3 vomitus samples sent to Referral Lab, GMC, Nagpur; results awaited. 3 more vomitus samples sent to Sevagram Medical College, Wardha. Samples tested positive for E.coli. One stool sample and food samples collected by FDA and sent to PH Lab, Pune; results awaited. IEC activities undertaken regarding safe food and drinking water, hygienic practices and sanitation measures.

Cases reported from Village Bamhanpali, SC Mahuapali, PHC Chaple, Block Kharsia, District Raigarh. Block health team investigated the outbreak. House to house search for cases done. All cases treated symptomatically. Affected children were less than 14 years of age. Health education given regarding isolation of cases.

96 cases and 8 deaths have been reported from Andhra Pradesh (upto 15th April, 2012) due to Influenza A H1N1. From 16th April to 22nd April 2012, further 7 cases occurred in the state. These new cases were mostly reported from Hyderabad and Ranga Reddy districts.

103 cases and 8 deaths have been reported from Andhra Pradesh (upto 22nd April, 2012) due to Influenza A H1N1. From 23rd April to 29th April 2012, further 4 cases and 1 death occurred in the state. These new cases were reported from Hyderabad and Mahabubnagar districts.

117 cases and 9 deaths have been reported from state of Andhra Pradesh (till 6th May, 2012) due to Influenza A H1N1. From 7th May to 13th May 2012, further 5 cases and 3 deaths occurred in the state. These new cases and deaths were reported from Hyderabad, Kurnool and Ranga Reddy districts.

Date of Reporting: Outbreak reported from Village Jautuk Pasi, SC Badajhata, CHC and Block Parjang, District Dhenkanal. District RRT investigated the outbreak. All children under 5 given a dose of Measles vaccine along with Vitamin-A solution. 9 sample collected and sent for testing; results awaited. Health education given.

Outbreak reported from Village and PHC-CHC Manakapur & Borgaon, Block Chikkodi, District Belgaum. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Out of 13 serum samples collected, 10 were positive for Hepatitis E (IgM ELISA). These villages are near to Ichalkaranji Town in Maharashtra which is currently affected by a major outbreak of Viral Hepatitis E. The people from these villages visit Ichalkaranji, daily for different purposes. House to house survey done. Temporary clinics established in the affected area. Alternative source of safe drinking water supplied. Chlorination of drinking water sources done. IEC through Miking and Group Talks done regarding disease control and prevention. Posters and pamphlets distributed.

Date of Start of Outbreak: Cases reported from Village Garibacha Wada, Block Kalyan Corporation, Area Shridhar Mhatre Chauk, District Thane. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 3 serum samples collected from patients in the locality who had fever. Samples sent to NIV, Pune. 1 sample tested positive for Dengue by IgM ELISA. Mosquito control measures (Spraying and Fogging operations) and Active Daily Surveillance for new fever cases initiated in the area. IEC activities undertaken.
Comments/ Action Taken: nannan

No. of Cases: 12 (cumul ative till 1/7/201 2)
Current Status: 3803 cases and 12 deaths were reported till 17th June 2012 and further cases reported from adjoining Blocks Shirol, Panhala, District Kolhapur. Currently a total of 5165 cases and 12 deaths were reported till 1st July 2012. Health education given regarding drinking of boiled water, and proper water purification. Chlorine tablets distributed. Pipe leakages corrected. Private practitioners in the area briefed regarding sample collection and proper treatment of patients. IEC activities along with close monitoring are ongoing by health teams.
Comments/ Action Taken: nannannan

Date of Reporting: Outbreak reported from Village SG Koppalu, PHC-CHC Jignehalli, Block Kadur, District Chikmagalur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search of new cases done. 2 stool samples collected and sent to Shimoga Medical College; result showed positive for Cholera culture. Safe drinking water was provided in the affected area. Temporary clinic organized in the village. Patients were treated at Kadur General Hospital.

Cases reported from Village Gokalpura, SC Baramuda- 2, PHC Ghodasar, Block Mahemdavad, District Kheda. District & Block RRTs investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 4 serum samples taken & sent to NHL Municipal Medical College Ahmedabad; result awaited. Out of 3 water samples tested all 3 were not potable. Chlorine tablets distributed in the area. All pipeline leakages repaired. Co-ordination with Sarpanch of Panchayat for effective control measures and IEC regarding personal hygiene and safe drinking water practices done.

Date of Start of Outbreak: Outbreak reported from Village Beldih, SC Pasrapali, PHC Tumgaon, Block Saraipali, District Mahasamund due to consumption of contaminated water. Medical team investigated the outbreak. People consumed water from hand pump and well. Health camp organized in the locality. Cases treated symptomatically. 9 cases treated at local health centre. Chlorination of water sources done. IEC done.

Outbreak reported from Village & SC Kosampali, PHC Patsendri, Block Saraipali, District Mahasamund due to consumption of contaminated water. Outbreak was investigated by Block health team. House to house survey done. Health camp organized in the locality. Cases treated locally. 11 patients treated at local health centre. Chlorine tablets distributed. Chlorination of water sources done. Health education given.

Date of Reporting: Outbreak reported from Village Antharam, SC Ithole, PHC & Block Tadoor, District Mahabubnagar. Medical team investigated the outbreak. People have adopted water storage practices due to scarcity of water. Temporary medical camps established. Entomological survey revealed high vector indices. 46 sources (containers) were positive for Aedes larva in 102 houses. Majority of population are daily laborers who migrate to cities and towns. 21 blood smears collected and tested negative for malaria parasite. Out of 5 serum samples collected, 2 samples were positive for Dengue (IgM ELISA). Anti larval operations, Pyrethrum spray and fogging done in the community. Health education given.

Date of Start of Outbreak: Outbreak reported from Village Golbhan, SC Tembhurli, PHC Khardi, Block Shahapur, District Thane. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. All cases treated. 5 serum samples collected and sent to NIV, Pune; result awaited. Blood smears collected were negative for malaria parasite. Serum samples were negative for Leptospirosis. Anit-larval measures undertaken. Control measures undertaken.

Outbreak reported from Village & SC Sankhe, PHC Gorhe, Block Wada, District Thane. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Out of 542 blood smears examined, 48 were positive for P.faliciparum and 39 postive for P.vivax. Fogging and spraying done in the affected village.

Outbreak reported from Village Mira Bazar, Block Kligan, District Nadia. Medical team visited the affected area. House to house fever survey done. Cases treated at local health centre. Health education done. 5 patents treated at District Hospital Nadia. 18 serum samples collected and sent to NRSMC Kolkata out of which 4 samples tested positive for Dengue by IgM ELISA.

Cases of fever with joint pain reported from Village Garapota Pachim Para, Block Hanskhali, District Nadia. Block health team investigated the outbreak. Cases treated at local health centre. 17 serum samples collected and sent to NRSMC Kolkata out of which 2 samples tested positive for Chikungunya by IgM ELISA. Health education given.

Current Status: Cases of jaundice reported from Village Kaddach, SC Jawalapur, District Haridwar due to consumption of contaminated water (pipeline leakage). District RRT visited the affected area. House to house survey done. Symptomatic treatment given to cases. 15 serum samples collected and sent to Himalayan Institute Hospital Trust, Dehradun, out of which 3 samples tested positive for Hepatitis E and 1 sample for Hepatitis A by IgM ELISA. Repair of pipeline leakage done by Jal Sansthan. Alternate supply of drinking water provided in the community. Chlorine tablets distributed to the local households. Health education given.
Comments/ Action Taken: nannannan

Current Status: Outbreak of fever for 2-7 days with retro orbital pain, arthralgia and myalgia reported from Ward Mahigram, Town area Roorkee, District Haridwar. State/District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. On investigation breeding places for Aedes mosquito were found in coolers, tyres and around hand pumps in the affected area. Medical camp was organized at Urban Health Centre Mahigram and treatment of cases done. All cases tested negative for malaria. 31 serum samples collected and sent to Himalayan Institute Hospital Trust, Dehradun out of which 18 samples were positive for Dengue (IgM ELISA). Entomological survey revealed; HI 70 & BI 160. IRS and fogging done in the affected area. IEC activities done regarding personal protective measures and sanitation.
Comments/ Action Taken: nannannan

Date of Reporting: Outbreak reported from Baradighi Tea Garden, Block Metali, District Jalpaiguri. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Source of drinking water was from rural water supply Sajaldhara and wells in the affected area. People practice open defecation. All cases treated symptomatically. ORS packets given to cases. 2 stool samples collected and sent to North Bengal Medical College Darjeeling; result awaited. IEC done.
Comments/ Action Taken: nannan

Date of Reporting: Outbreak of gastroenteritis reported from Village Tuljapur, SC Magrul (T), PHC Kumbhari, Block Nanduri, District Osmanabad. Medical team investigated the outbreak. On investigation multiple leakage in water supply pipeline were detected. Temporary medical camp established in the locality. Chlorine tablets distributed in the community by health workers. Pipeline leakages were repaired and instructions given to Gram Pradhan for arrangement of safe drinking water in the village. Out of 7 water samples collected and sent to DPHL Osmanabad, 4 samples were non potable. IEC done regarding use of boiled water for drinking purpose.
Comments/ Action Taken: nannannannan

Current Status: Cases reported from Village Sadadkuva, SC Nisana, PHC Agasvan, Block Songadh. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Contaminated milk could be the probable cause of the outbreak. Out of 01 Water, 3 Food and 01 Vomit sample collected and sent to GH Vyara; water sample tested non potable and all 3 food samples tested negative for pathogens. Health camp organized and all cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Hingpora, SC Khadar, CHC Kapran, Block Vering. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Out of 08 serum samples tested at DPHL; Srinagar, 4 were found positive for Hepatitis A. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Burusai, HSC Kheriatangar, CHC Tantnagar. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All 05 serum samples tested at DPHL Chaibasa; found negative for Varicella. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village/HSC/PHCJ.G Halli Taluk Hiriyur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Out of 9 serum samples tested at NIV Bangalore, 1 found positive for Measles IgM. One sample of vesicular fluid sent to MCVR Manipal tested positive for IgM Varicella. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given

Cases reported from Village Yerlapady, CHC-- Bailur, Taluk Karkala. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All cases were 10 – 19 years of age. Out of 05 serum samples tested at NIV Bangalore, 4 were found positive for IgM Measles. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given

Comments/ Action Taken: Cases reported from Village Gavdi Devsi, SHC Kharsodkala, Block Bhatpachlana. Majority of cases were in 4-6 years of age group. All 6 Serum samples tested at MGMC, Indore, were found to be positive for Measles IgM ELISA. District

Current Status: Cases reported from Village- Nawalaspur, HSC/PHC Chillaragi Block Bidar. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Out of 05 serum samples tested at SIMS Shivmogga, 4 were positive for IgM Mumps. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given

Cases reported from Village Thenkae Yedapadav, PHC Kompadav, Taluk Mangalore. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 4 Serum samples and 2 throat swabs sent to NIV Bangalore, result awaited. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Kerebandipallya, PHC Baluvanerala, CHC Hulinalli, Block Tiptur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 02 Blood serum samples tested at MCVR Manipal were positive for IgM Varicella. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given

Cases reported from Village East Kavanur, HSC/PHC/CHC Kavanur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Out of 17 Blood samples tested at Government Medical college, Manjeri; 11 were positive for Hepatitis A (IgM ELISA). All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from PHC Udayanapuram, block Edayazham. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All cases had consumed food in a social ceremony. Food samples collected and sent to Government analytical Laboratory, Thiruvanathapuram; result awaited. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given

Cases reported from Village-Khawbung, PHC-Khawbung Majority of cases were in mixed age group. Out of 73 Serum samples tested at DH Champai, 41 were found to be positive for Scrub Typhus. House to house survey done. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given
Cases reported from Village Algeniguda, Block- K. Singhpur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given

1 Case was reported from Village Hivrem, CHC Valpoi. 4 more cases reported in week 51st. Out of 52 Serum sample tested, 5 were positive for KFD, at MCVR, Manipal. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given

706 cases were reported in week 50th from 2 blocks of the district. Cases reported from 4 more blocks of district Ease Singhbhum. Cases reported were: 9 Sub Centres Patamda 1773 617 509 All over the block Musabani 2317 602 571 6 sub centres Ghatshila 1470 224 193 6 sub centres Dalbhumgarh 1454 124 94 7014 1567 1367 200 District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey

161 Cases and 3 deaths were reported in week 33rd. 27 more cases have occurred subsequently in Village Lumshken, PHC Iapmala and 141 more cases in Village Byrwai, PHC Sohkymphor of adjacent Block Khliehriat. District RRT investigated the outbreak. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given. Vitamin A doses given.

Cases reported from Bokra Beda, Sub Centre Hirridih (Nagari), probably due to consumption of poisonous leafy vegetable. All cases presented with loose motion and vomiting. Cases treated by medical team. Door to door survey done for new cases. Health education given and IEC activities done regarding food hygiene.
Comments/ Action Taken: nannan

Date of Reporting: Outbreak occurred due to consumption of contaminated water in Brahmanwada village (115 cases & 1 death) and Hardoi village (81 cases) of Block Amla- (The Amla Block is farther from above mentioned Bhimpur and Bhainsdehi blocks)- District RRT investigated the outbreak in the affected area- Water samples collected and sent for investigation- All curative and preventive measures undertaken- Chlorination of water sources done and chlorine tablets distributed among the villagers-

Cases reported from Talarengapani village, GP – Tentulipadar, SC – Ichapur, Block - PHC – Narayanpatna- PHC team headed by MO I-C visited the village on 25-08-09 and taken all the preventive measures- Tube well disinfect, villagers are using stream water for all purpose-

Current Status: Outbreak reported from adjoining areas of Ward Rajiv Nagar, Bangali Colony, Ward Nagina Colony and Ward 25 Acre Lalkuan. Cases presented with fever and body ache. Critical cases admitted in hospital. Medical team visited the area to investigate the outbreak. Blood slides for malaria collected from all fever cases and sera samples taken for lab investigation; reports awaited. Insecticide spray done. IEC activities done and health education given regarding use of mosquito net and personal protection measures like sanitation and hygiene.

Date of Reporting: Outbreak reported from Jambhulpada, PHC Sirasgaon, Taluka Trimbak- RRT visited the affected area- Rapid fever survey and entomological survey done- Anti-larval measures undertaken- One blood sample tested positive for P-falciparum- Cases treated with anti- malarial drugs- Vector control measures undertaken-

Outbreak reported from Devlali Camp, Taluka Nashik- Sera samples tested positive for Dengue IgM antibodies at NIV Pune- RRT visited the affected area and conducted rapid fever survey and container survey- Anti-mosquito measures like fogging, etc- done-
